content.description:
Start as for Aesthetics, climb the crack until you reach the horizontal crack splitting the wall and traverse across the face.  The crux is transitioning from the crack to the face with some in your face crimping until the top.

A king line in MC.  Much better climbing than Aesthetics.  Originally rated 13c but the crux gaston has broke and gotten smaller - most people say 13d now.  If you're tall enough to use the foot ledge at the end of the traverse you'll be thankful.
content.protection: Bolts, though it's been done on gear.  Long slings and skipping bolts essential for rope drag

content.description: This one looks hard and scary.
content.location: The rightmost route on the wall with the Black Widow arete.

content.description: Starts off in a chimney/offwidth which you can either squeeze into or lieback. This continues for another 10-15 feet before you can grab some edges and jugs and make your way up, trending left. Crux is probably the first two bolts.
content.location: This route is on the left side of the wall with Magic Carpet Ride. Has a big hueco around the first bolt.

climbs.name: Magic Carpet Ride
climbs.fa: Pete Verchick, Kevin Chase and Eric Decaria. c. 1995

content.description: This is the first route you encounter after crossing the log.  It is on the right arete of the right wall.
There's a few cruxes with rests in between.  Hard to clip the 3rd bolt if there's no draw in.
content.protection: 6 or so bolts to chain anchors
content.location: This route is to the right of Black Widow Arete and is the center route on this wall.

climbs.name: Donut Project
climbs.fa: None. Equipped by Zack Miller, and Josh Wharton Fall 2018

content.description:
Although short, this project is very aesthetic, and extremely difficult. Technical lay backing, with minimal feet, on a beautiful wafer thin flake.

I imagine it's in the V11 to V14 range, and will certainly be the hardest route in Mill Creek if it's ever climbed.

Edit 10/26/21...Griffin's comment inspired me to rename this the Donut project. Please contact me for a free box of a dozen donuts if you send this lil' beauty.
content.location: Directly across from the Wicked Crag, in a small alcove, to the right of Banditos.

content.description: Once across the log, there is an obvious black varnished wall.  Scramble up to the base of the wall.  Black Widow Arete follows a line of bolts up the left margin of this wall.  Thin climbing.
The crux is between the second and third bolt
content.protection: 6 or so bolts to rap bolts.
content.location: To the left of Magic Carpet Ride, this is the center route on this wall.

content.description:
Animal makes, what I consider, the third in a trifecta of brilliant conclusions to the Aesthetics Wall. Begin as for Aesthetics/Prosthetics, following the crack to a stance in the chimney that marks the the leftward transition into the above routes. Instead of moving left, tug straight up the coffin prow feature. Resistance compression movement and nearly pure feature climbing with incredible position ensue.

The grade is merely speculation. The compressive nature of the climbing and the dimensions of the prow make the route highly morphological. I hope others will give the pitch a try and add their consensus.
content.protection: Although the route is entirely bolted, I placed a finger-sized piece in the horizontal instead of clipping the bolt that marks the transition between Aesthetics and Prosthetics. I felt this alleviated any chance of the rope running behind my feet when standing up on the prow. If you choose to clip the bolt I'd recommend using a runner.
content.location: Aesthetics Wall. The coffin-shaped prow right of Aesthetics.

content.description: Located on the streaked wall left of the sunny side crag.  Two beautiful, hard looking lines comprise this wall.  Aesthetics starts down by the stream and follows bolts straight up.  A devious crux awaits.
